Description: Segmental bowl with a plain tapered rim and a rounded base; sandy brown-grey coloured fabric, fired black and burnished on both the interior and exterior; salt deposit on the base of both the interior and exterior, the upper section of one half of the rim has been eroded by sand. Handmade. Incomplete but with complete profile.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site H16 Locus 24712
Type series: NDRS type BO18.2 (published form type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.316, fig. 5.47)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 946x (excavation type series number)
